content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Processing Line at (20.5, 21.5)
Consists of following entities:
- Wooden chest (source) at position (20.5, 21.5)
- Source inserter at position (21.5, 21.5) facing downward
- Furnace inserter at position (22.5, 20.5) facing right
- Stone furnace at position (24.0, 20.0)
- Belt group connecting the inserters with complex routing:
  - Input belt at (22.5, 22.5)
  - Multiple transport belts forming a path between source and furnace inserters
  - Output belt ending at (21.5, 21.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Belt Connection Inefficiencies
- The current belt connection between inserters is overly complex with unnecessary routing
- Create direct, shorter belt connections between components to improve efficiency
- Minimize the number of belt segments and turns when connecting entities

### Entity Placement and Spacing
- Ensure proper spacing between production line components
- Place related entities (like inserters and furnaces) close to each other to minimize belt length
- Consider the direction of inserters and belt flow when planning layout

Note: Since this is the first report (no previous history), only the current structure and observed issues are included.
